text.p: These are some of the leading stories in Kuwait's press on Thursday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

- Finance Minister Rodhan says Kuwait studying measures to allow non-Kuwaitis to trade in shares of local firms. Kuwait has formed committee to study ways of encouraging foreign investment and opening Kuwait Stock Exchange for foreigners.
- United Arab Emirates plans strict measures against UAE-flagged vessels violating U.N. trade embargo against Iraq.
- Chairman of Kuwait's Chamber of Commerce and Industry opens Egyptian products exhibition.
- Kuwait to market unleaded gasoline in domestic market by end of 1997.
- Kuwait, Iran to sign accord on preventing double taxation.
- Iraq's President Saddam studies possibility of establishing free trade zone in southern Iraq.

- Expatriates say 50-dinar ($167) annual health fee to be imposed by government should not be mandatory. Kuwait plans to charge its 1.2 million foreign residents health insurance fee of about 50 dinars in 1998. Health services are free for Kuwaitis.
